intro: Hapalochilus coloratus, commonly known as the red-flowered bell heath, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, commonly referred to as the heath or heather family. The plant is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically bright red or pink in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Hapalochilus coloratus is a perennial shrub that produces small, leathery leaves and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions.
